burlap.mdp.stochasticgames.tournament

Class Tournament

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.mdp.stochasticgames.tournament.Tournament

  • public class Tournament
extends Object
    This class is designed to run tournaments of sets of users. It is particularly useful when there are a large number of agents whose performance is going to be compared in games in which only a subset of the agents can participate at a time, for instance running a tournament of many agents in 2-player games like iterated prisoner's dilemma. The Tournament class requires a list of agents, a world generator and a match selector. The MatchSelector determines which agents will be matched up in a game, which SGAgentType role they will play as and how many matches there will be.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      • Tournament

        public Tournament(int maxStages,
                  MatchSelector selector,
                  WorldGenerator worldGenerator)
        Initializes the Tournament
        Parameters:
        maxStages - the maximum number of stages to be played in any single game of the tournament.
        selector - a match selector that dictates which agents will play who and in which games
        worldGenerator - a world generator to create new worlds for each match
